body:
@crawshaw @kardianos 

Re: the concerns about the word project. I want to be clear that there is an unfortunate confusion between the gb use of the word, and the way I am using it in this context. To say it another way

People work on projects who's source code lives in repositories. So, you release a version of your project, by tagging the repository that holds its code.

To avoid confusion, and to make it clear that this is not a proposal driven solely by or for gb, I'll attempt to replace the word Project with Repository in the next draft.

Daniel, to respond to your concerns that this proposal is pushing a unique or specialised world view, I must respectfully disagree. Source code lives in repositories, tags apply repository wide, so that is the unit of releasing code. This isn't unique to Go, this is a common pattern across many languages.
